summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for the date August 10, 2019. The sheets are for various tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) and detail the required irregular observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, with signature lines for staff. The documents were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.

persons.name: Morning Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who reviewed the inmate observation check sheets for the morning shift.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The senior officer who reviewed the inmate observation check sheets.

events.title: Inmate Observation Rounds at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Standard 30-minute observation checks were conducted throughout the day and night for inmates held in the Special Housing Unit under continuous locked-down status.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets detailing inmate observation protocols for August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell.
It confirms the standard operating procedure for observing inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York, requiring checks at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets cover multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the SHU, indicating the unit's layout and inmate population.
Each sheet was reviewed and signed off by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, documenting supervisory oversight.
The document itself does not name any specific inmates or detail any specific incidents; it is a procedural record.
